Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Controller
  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls changes in the status of the Game. One Controller is instantiated for each Game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private VirtualView virtualView
      A reference to the VirtualView of the same Game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Controller​(VirtualView virtualView)
      This is the only constructor.

    • Field Detail

      • virtualView

        private VirtualView virtualView
        A reference to the VirtualView of the same Game. This is useful for allowing message exchanges that involve a multiple sequence of request/response before any effect actually takes action on the Game. It's essentially a shortcut that skips the model altogether as long as it doesn't have enough information to fully describe a state transition.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller​(VirtualView virtualView)
        This is the only constructor.
        Parameters:
        virtualView - The VirtualView that calls this constructor and passes itself as argument.

    • Method Detail

      • spawn

        public void spawn​(Player subject,
                  PowerUp powerUpToDiscard)
        Causes a Player to spawn, after they selected the PowerUp to discard.
        Parameters:
        subject - The player that is about to spawn.
        powerUpToDiscard - The PowerUp the player has discarded. The PowerUp's colour is used to infer the cell where the spawn event will take place.

      • discardPowerUp

        public void discardPowerUp​(Player subject,
                           PowerUp toDiscard)
        Causes a Player to discard a PowerUp card.
        Parameters:
        subject - The player who has discarded a PowerUp.
        toDiscard - The PowerUp to remove from the player's hand and place back into the Deck.

      • discardWeapon

        public void discardWeapon​(Player subject,
                          Weapon toDiscard)
        Causes a Player to discard a Weapon.
        Parameters:
        subject - The player who has discarded a weapon.
        toDiscard - The weapon to remove from the player's hand.

      • move

        public void move​(Player subject,
                 Cell destination)
        Causes a Player to change position on the game Board.
        Parameters:
        subject - The player that is about to move.
        destination - The Cell the player

      • grabAmmo

        public boolean grabAmmo​(Player subject)
                 throws AbortedTurnException
        Causes a Player to Grab AmmoCubes from the Cell they are currently standing on.
        Parameters:
        subject - The player who is about to grab ammo.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the Grab was successful. For example, grabbing on an empty cell will be considered a failure case.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - When the request routine catches a ConnectionException and the current turn needs to be ended prematurely.

      • grabWeapon

        public void grabWeapon​(Player subject,
                       int weaponIndex)
                throws AbortedTurnException
        Causes a Player to purchase a Weapon from the weapon shop they are currently standing on.
        Parameters:
        subject - The player who is about to grab a weapon.
        weaponIndex - The index of the weapon inside the weapon shop.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - When the request routine catches a ConnectionException and the current turn needs to be ended prematurely.
        See Also:
        SpawnCell.getWeaponShop()

      • prepareForShoot

        public void prepareForShoot​(Player subject,
                            AttackPattern pattern)
        Sets up an AttackPattern to be authored by a Player and ready to be used.
        Parameters:
        subject - The attacker.
        pattern - The AttackPattern that the player intends to use.

      • shoot

        public void shoot​(Player subject,
                  AttackPattern pattern,
                  int moduleId)
           throws AbortedTurnException
        Starts an AttackModule and invokes the Target acquisition.
        Parameters:
        subject - The attacker.
        pattern - The AttackPattern the module belongs to.
        moduleId - The identifier of the AttackModule inside the AttackPattern.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - When the request routine catches a ConnectionException and the current turn needs to be ended prematurely.

      • shootTargets

        public void shootTargets​(Player subject,
                         AttackModule attackModule,
                         java.util.List<Target> targets)
                  throws AbortedTurnException
        After the target acquisition, it applies every Effect of the AttackModule.
        Parameters:
        subject - The attacker.
        attackModule - The AttackModule containing the Targets and Effects of relevance.
        targets - The Targets on which the Effects will be applied to.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - When the request routine catches a ConnectionException and the current turn needs to be ended prematurely.
        See Also:
        Effect

      • reload

        public void reload​(Player subject,
                   Weapon weapon)
        Causes a Player to Reload a Weapon and pay the relevant AmmoCubes cost.
        Parameters:
        subject - The buyer.
        weapon - The weapon about to be reloaded.

      • usePowerUp

        public void usePowerUp​(Player subject,
                       PowerUp powerUp)
                throws AbortedTurnException
        Causes a Player to use a PowerUp between turns (either Newton or Teleport).
        Parameters:
        subject - The player who is using a PowerUp.
        powerUp - The PowerUp being used by the player.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - When the request routine catches a ConnectionException and the current turn needs to be ended prematurely.

      • scope

        public void scope​(Damage damage,
                  java.util.List<Player> targets,
                  java.util.List<Player> scopedPlayers)
        Applies the Effect of a Scope PowerUp to an active Damage, increasing its value by 1.
        Parameters:
        damage - The Damage being buffed.
        targets - The Targets associated with the Damage Effect, scoped or not.
        scopedPlayers - The Targets associated with the Damage Effect that have been chosen as victims to the Scope's effect.

      • grenade

        public void grenade​(Player subject,
                    Player originalAttacker)
        Applies the Effect of a Grenade PowerUp.
        Parameters:
        subject - The player that was hit and chose to respond to the fire.
        originalAttacker - The original attacker, namely the target of the Grenade.

      • newton

        public void newton​(Player target,
                   Cell destination)
        Applies the Effect of a Newton PowerUp.
        Parameters:
        target - The player being moved.
        destination - The cell the player is being moved to.

      • teleport

        public void teleport​(Player subject,
                     Cell destination)
        Applies the Effect of a Teleport PowerUp.
        Parameters:
        subject - The player using the PowerUp, i.e. the player being moved.
        destination - The player's destination Cell.
